description: This file provides utility functions to handle feature flags and environment variables for a React frontend application. It includes parsing of boolean-like environment variables, and functions to check if authentication is disabled and to get current feature flags and experiment status.
external_files: The environment variables like REACT_APP_DISABLE_AUTH, REACT_APP_FEATURE_FLAGS, REACT_APP_EXPERIMENTS_ENABLED

methods.name: parseBool(val, defaultValue = false)
methods.description: Parses boolean-like environment variable string values such as 'true', '1', 'yes', 'on' into a boolean. Uses a default value if input is empty or undefined.

methods.name: isAuthDisabled()
methods.description: Checks environment variable to determine if authentication is disabled for local testing.

methods.name: getFeatureFlags()
methods.description: Returns an object containing the list and map of feature flags parsed from environment variables, as well as experiment enabled status and auth disabled status.
